commitResults.messageTitle: Increment 1 functionalities: Greets, echos, and says goodbye to user.
Increment 2; Added list feature, add to list feature
Added features for Increment 3, ability to mark and unmark Tasks, Tasks are now encapsulated as a class. TaskStorage is now also a class.
Added features for Increment 4; Added 3 new classes, Deadline, ToDo, Event which all inherit Task.
Initiated automated text testing, added DukeException class to prepare for next increment.
increment 5 features. Handled a large variety of possible errors.
deleted DukeException as it is not needed for now.
Completed changes for increment 6. Added the ability to delete tasks. Also updated the status message for "mark" and "unmark" commands so users know which task the action was performed on.
Add ability to store tasks in hard drive so they do not disappear when Duke session is closed.
Make DeadLine class store and print deadlines as a LocalDate
Add more OOP by separating out the Ui, Storage, and TaskList classes.
Add all existing classes into a package called duke.
Add Parser Class.
Add JUnit tests for ToDo String Description and Parse behaviour for "bye" and invalid command message.
Remove "updated hard drive" message.
Add javadoc comments
Add style changes so it follows coding standards
add find feature
Add graphical user interface to Duke
Change the version of javafx api used
Add assert functionality
Add the use of java assertations
commitResults.messageBody:
There are key junctures in our code that are likely to throw a
critical error.

Using java assertations helps us to catch these critical faults
early.

Let's add java assertations in our code.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve the quality of the code through refactoring
commitResults.messageBody:
The current code has much room for improvement in terms of clarity
and length.

Let's improve the code quality.

commitResults.messageTitle: Clean up code
Add DoAfter task functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, no tasks support the capability for the user to complete the task after a certain date.

This would be useful for the user to keep track of tasks that are to be done only after a certain date.

Let's add this task functionality to our app.
